def.dt: :a very young child She had the baby yesterday. = She gave birth to the baby yesterday. Are you expecting a baby? [=are you pregnant?] I hear the baby crying. The baby is just learning to crawl. often used before another noun a baby girl/boy baby clothes baby pictures a baby monitor (US) I gave my sister a baby shower. [=a party at which gifts are given to a woman who is pregnant] She has a real baby face. [=a face that resembles the face of a baby; a face that looks young and innocent]
:a very young animal a bird and its babies often used before another noun a baby bird a baby deer
:the youngest member of a group My sister is the baby of the family. often used before another noun my baby sister
:someone who is young in comparison with others “Only 32? Oh, you're just a baby!”
:someone who behaves like a child
:someone who is afraid or who complains a lot When it comes to getting shots, I'm a real baby. Don't be such a baby—you'll get your turn.
:a lover or sweetheart Nothing's gone right since my baby went away. This sense of baby is common in song lyrics.

dt.un: used as an informal way of addressing a lover, friend, etc.
used especially by men to address women and by women to address men I missed you, baby.
dt.snote: This sense of baby is sometimes used in a very informal way by men to address an attractive woman. Hey baby, nice car! Using baby to address someone you do not know well may cause offense.

def.dt: :something that someone has created and developed with special personal attention or interest This project is my baby.

dro.dre: throw out the baby with the bathwater

def.dt: :to get rid of something you want while trying to get rid of something you do not want If you ignore her message because you don't like the way she presents it, you will be throwing out the baby with the bathwater.

utxt.vi: We watched him grow from babyhood to adulthood.

def.dt: :very small :much smaller than usual a baby grand piano baby carrots/vegetables Take baby steps.

:to treat (someone) like a baby :to be kind or too kind to (someone) That boy will never learn to stand up for himself if you don't stop babying him. I babied myself [=pampered myself] with a trip to the spa.
:to operate or treat (something) in a very careful and gentle way baby a car It looked like he was babying his injured foot.
:a very light blue color
:blue eyes She gazed into his baby blues.
:a feeling of sadness that a woman has after giving birth to a baby She had a bad case of the baby blues. compare postpartum depression

utxt.vi: He was wearing baby blue pajamas.

def.dt: :a time when there is a great increase in the number of babies born There was a baby boom in the U.S. after World War II.

utxt.vi: a television program that is popular among baby boomers [=people who were born during the baby boom after World War II]

def.dt: :baby carriage
:stroller
:a vehicle in which a baby lies while someone pushes it from place to place called also (US) baby buggy (Brit) pram
:the extra fat that a healthy baby or young child has Their little boy still has his baby fat. called also (Brit) puppy fat
:the speech used by very young children who are learning to talk or by adults who are speaking to young children
:a tooth from the first set of teeth that a child develops called also milk tooth
